title: Cannot join meetings
text: The app breaks the ability to join meetings if you refuse to give permission to scan devices on your local network. This setting has nothing to do with connecting to the internet, and isn’t necessary for my use of the app. Unfortunate that they chose to prevent me from joining meetings unless I give them the ability to harvest information about my local network. I have deleted the app.

title: Bug with authenticator
text: Since there’s not a way to report this. There’s a broken MFA loop with Microsoft authenticator. Never corrects, just ends up in a sign in loop. Would have reported if there was a bug button in the app or even on the help page. But here we are.

title: Add new features
text:
Zoom offers a variety of features that have contributed to its popularity as a video-conferencing tool. Some of the key features include:
Virtual Backgrounds: Allows users to change their background to an image or video during a call.
Keyboard Shortcuts: Provides various shortcuts for actions like muting, starting video, recording, etc.
App Integration: Enables connection with other apps like Google Calendar, Outlook, Slack, etc., for easy scheduling and joining of meetings.
Breakout Rooms: Permits the host to split the meeting into smaller groups for focused discussions.
Polls and Surveys: Facilitates the creation and launching of polls and surveys during meetings for interactive feedback.
Screen Sharing: Allows sharing of the screen or a specific window with participants.
Chat and Reactions: Offers chat messaging and the use of emojis and gestures for reactions.

But I’m sure that these things will be integrated in a better capacity. I’m liking it so far I’m using it for work and it has been beneficial. Nice going Microsoft. I had lost my faith in you, but you guys are slowly what surely regaining it to see greater integration in Windows 12.

title: Useless for corporate employees
text:
For the vast majority of corporate users, Teams won’t work on Vision Pro until Microsoft does the very trivial work of bringing over InTune to support MDM authentication and login.

Apple did the work to support MDM on AVP in version 1.1, now it’s all waiting on Microsoft. They could just check the box to allow us to use the iPad version of InTune, but so far they haven’t. Knowing Microsoft, it will be 2026 before this happens. Until then, all of the Office apps are just placeholders — not useable by the vast majority of Microsoft customers, and just window dressing for Apple’s launch.

Microsoft PLEASE DO THE BARE MINIMUM so that we can actually use these apps.

title: Apple CarPlay bug
text: Previous versions had great CarPlay integration for chats, where Siri would read your messages to you. This no longer works. Please fix.

title: Not getting notifications
text: Not getting notifications anymore have to check manually.

title: Phantom Notifications
text:
I have a constant notification in my badge app icon, and I’ve check every spot that could possibly have a notification. I’ve used the “mark all as read” option, and well as reinstalling the app, restarting my phone, logging out then in again. It goes away for a little while when I do those things, but it always comes back. It reads different number each time too, it was at a constant 17 for a little while, now it’s at 1. It’s all very annoying, and I can never tell if I have a new message or not. 

Otherwise, the app works fine.  I haven’t had any issues transferring from my computer to phone and vice-versa. I haven’t set up meeting through the app, but I have been able to access files, as long as they are in the “general” folder (I also find that a little frustrating, we sometime have things in “Documents” instead).

title: Needs a lot of improvement. This is an embarrassment
text:
Specifically for VisionOS, though I have various complaints for the desktop version as well.

I have a daily meeting with my team that is convenient to take on my VisionPro. Without fail, I have to force quit the app and rejoin the meeting in order for people to hear me. All other standard troubleshooting does not work. (Leaving meeting and rejoining, closing the app and re-launching, manually toggling mute button). Very annoying.

The tabs on the left seem to have a hard time updating on their own unless I look at the app and manually check through them. This makes it useless to have the app open where I can glance and see if I have new messages or new activity since I can never trust that it’s up to date. I have to make the app active and cycle through them. Beyond any annoyance level, this severely cripples the usability of the app as a standalone app, and makes it more of a nice gimmicky extension to running the app on another device.

Another app breaking thing is that some of the containers seem to have a defined minimum size, which is fair enough, lots of apps do that. However, the developers failed to take this into account when setting limits on the app window itself. you can easily make that app too narrow or too short to be able to see all the controls, for example the text input box to reply to messages. So unless you leave the app at the standard size it is when it launches, or make it huge; you are left to play this guessing game when resizing the window and hoping that you’ve allowed room for everything, which you won’t know until you actually need the thing.

If this was some Indy app that was really cheap, or better yet free; these sorts of things one could live with hoping they are eventually fixed. However given that it’s a paid app from a TRILLION dollar company that I am forced to use for work, these sorts of things, especially aggregated all together are unforgivable. And yes, I realize the app itself is free, but you or an employer ends up paying for your account in some vast majority if not all use cases.

I waited to write a review hoping for a day one patch, then a week one or two, but it is coming up on a month since launch.

title: Ghost Notifications
text: I work off my phone and computer. With the new update I'll read a chat on the computer but I'll still have an unread badge notification on my phone app 1-2 hours after a chat was read from the computer. #sad

title: Notifications just stopped

Using a iPhone 13 pro.
